name: places/ChIJs_rGaxlZwokRiCihZcfKfgM
formattedAddress: 126 E 13th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 126 E 13th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: I started stepping into faith and got my first Bible in 2018, yet I still consider myself a relatively new Christian. I’ve now attended many church services all around the world, and I must say that Reunion offers something special. Intelligent and relevant sermons rooted in Jesus and Scripture, kind staff, various opportunities to serve within NYC, a willingness to pray for anyone/anytime, talented musicians, childcare during service, fun celebrations and more. I like the way they do things. I have made many friendships, deepened my faith and understanding, discovered lots of great music and I got baptized with Russel/Reunion, at the beach! My wife and I have been coming in for more than a year and we love it.

originalText.text: Reunion is the first church I’ve been to that has felt like home. After months of churches not feeling like the right fit in NYC, my first Sunday at Reunion I felt so known and seen by others that I immediately knew this was what I had been searching for. There is something uniquely beautiful about the way this community serves and loves one another and this city wholeheartedly. This is a group of people who you are meant to live life with for Jesus every day, not just on Sundays.

originalText.text: My wife and I have been attending Reunion Church for several years. It is a place where we are seen, known, and loved without fail. I am floored by the kindness and commitment of the folks I've met here -- each one is living out the Gospel for the good of everyone in our city, not just those who look or act like them. Whether you are unsure of what Christianity means to you, healing from past church experiences, or just curious, you are welcome here.

originalText.text: I moved here last year and feel like Reunion is my family away from home.  Reunion was the second church I tried and I immediately felt welcomed which was amazing since I didn’t know anyone in the city once I had moved. All are welcome and we hope you’ll visit us one Sunday morning!

text.text: I moved here last year and feel like Reunion is my family away from home.  Reunion was the second church I tried and I immediately felt welcomed which was amazing since I didn’t know anyone in the city once I had moved. All are welcome and we hope you’ll visit us one Sunday morning!

originalText.text: I grew up in the church, but have never experienced such rich, deep community like I have since joining Reunion. Reunion is so much of why we felt “at home” since moving to the city 1 year ago. Russel and Katie have been so inclusive, and have really encouraged all those who join worship gatherings to take part in all the efforts the church is making together. We feel part of something bigger with Reunion as a whole, and we feel known even after just 1 year. It feels like a family, and really emulates what I believe Jesus intended the church to be.
